channel.title: Custom Currency & Making shops use them
channel.description:
Hi,
So I had my friend code a shop for me in the past using custom currency (tokkul).
How would I go about this for another shop?
Wanneshop = 97, npcid is 659 i believe.
Thank you so much!
317 Delta
Also what could I use for a custom currency that is already in game?
Thank you.

item.title: Custom Currency & Making shops use them
item.dc:creator: @xxxxxx_13 xxxxxx 13
item.description:
@xxxxxx_13 wrote:

3706 Champions token
4278 Ecto-token
4691 Sphinx’s token
6183 Frog token
7478 Dragon token
7774 Reward token
7775 Reward token
7776 Reward token

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Currency & Making shops use them
item.dc:creator: @SGTCannon SGTCannon
item.description:
@SGTCannon wrote:

xxxxxx 13:

Dragon Tokens are often popular. I used Partyhats in one of my servers a long time ago. LOL. Ive also used Remains for a minigame. Like dwarf remains? Hmm what else. Theres a few different types of tickets in the 317 cache. Just look through.

I don’t suppose you know any item codes? (Dragon tokens mainly)

Read full topic

item.source: Custom Currency & Making shops use them

item.title: Custom Currency & Making shops use them
item.dc:creator: @Untrimmed Untrimmed
item.description:
@Untrimmed wrote:

Ok so this is the code for making a shop accept tokkul. if (MyShopID == 97) { if (playerItemsN[Slot2] >= TotPrice2) { if (freeSlots() > 0) { deleteItem(6529, GetItemSlot(6529), TotPrice2); addItem(itemID, 1); server.shopHandler.ShopItemsN[MyShopID][fromSlot] -= 1; server.shopHandler.ShopItemsDelay[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; if ((fromSlot + 1) > server.shopHandler.ShopItemsStandard[MyShopID]) { server.shopHandler.ShopItems[MyShopID][fromSlot] = 0; } } else { sM("Not enough space in your inventory."); break; } } else { sM("Not enough tokkul for this item."); } }
You can very easily change this around to accept a different item or pkpoints. The next thing you have to add is this.

if (MyShopID == 97) { sM(getItemName(removeID)+": currently costs "+ShopValue+" tokkul"+ShopAdd); }else{
This should be placed in the int ShopValue = (int) Math.floor(GetItemShopValue(removeID, 0,removeSlot)); Once you search that in client.java it would make more sense as of where to put it. I think that is all that you need to know, if you need any more help just tell me.

Read full topic
